glsa.title: Evolution: Format string vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A format string error has been discovered in Evolution, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Evolution is a GNOME groupware application.

description.p: Ulf Harnhammar from Secunia Research discovered a format string error in the emf_multipart_encrypted() function in the file mail/em-format.c when reading certain data (e.g. the "Version:" field) from an encrypted e-mail.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted encrypted e-mail, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Evolution.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Evolution users should upgrade to the latest version:
